topBar.waitingForPython: Waiting for Python engine to load...

blockDescriptions.sampleData: Load built-in sample datasets for learning
blockDescriptions.createDataset: Manually create a dataset by entering data
blockDescriptions.sort: Sort data by one or more columns
blockDescriptions.groupAggregate: Group data and apply aggregate functions
blockDescriptions.join: Combine two datasets based on common columns
blockDescriptions.handleMissing: Handle missing values in your data
blockDescriptions.sampleRows: Take a random sample of rows
blockDescriptions.pivot: Pivot data from long to wide format
blockDescriptions.unpivot: Unpivot data from wide to long format
blockDescriptions.splitColumn: Split a column into multiple columns
blockDescriptions.datetimeExtract: Extract parts from date columns (year, month, day, weekday, hour, etc.)
blockDescriptions.stringOperations: Clean and manipulate text columns (case, trim, find/replace, regex)
blockDescriptions.windowFunctions: Calculate rolling averages, cumulative sums, lag/lead values
blockDescriptions.binBucket: Group continuous numbers into discrete bins or ranges
blockDescriptions.typeConversion: Change column data types (string, integer, float, boolean, datetime)
blockDescriptions.fillForwardBackward: Fill missing values with previous or next values
blockDescriptions.lagLead: Create columns with shifted values (lag or lead)
blockDescriptions.rowNumber: Add a unique row number column
blockDescriptions.dateDifference: Calculate difference between two date columns
blockDescriptions.stringPad: Pad strings to a fixed length with specified character
blockDescriptions.cumulativeOperations: Calculate running totals, cumulative counts, and percentages
blockDescriptions.replaceValues: Map and replace specific values with new values
blockDescriptions.percentChange: Calculate percentage change between consecutive rows
blockDescriptions.roundNumbers: Round, floor, or ceiling numeric values
blockDescriptions.percentOfTotal: Calculate what percentage each row represents of the total
blockDescriptions.columnMath: Perform arithmetic operations between two columns
blockDescriptions.extractSubstring: Extract portion of text from a string column
blockDescriptions.parseDate: Convert text strings to proper date format
blockDescriptions.splitToRows: Expand delimited values in a cell into separate rows
blockDescriptions.clipValues: Cap values at minimum and/or maximum thresholds
blockDescriptions.caseWhen: Create column based on multiple if-then conditions
blockDescriptions.explodeColumn: Expand list/array values in a column into separate rows
blockDescriptions.addConstantColumn: Add a new column with a fixed value for all rows
blockDescriptions.dropColumns: Remove specific columns from the dataset
blockDescriptions.flattenJson: Expand nested dict/JSON columns into separate columns
blockDescriptions.coalesceColumns: Get the first non-null value from multiple columns
blockDescriptions.reorderColumns: Rearrange column order in the dataset
blockDescriptions.trimText: Remove whitespace and clean text formatting
blockDescriptions.lookupVlookup: Match and retrieve values from another dataset like Excel VLOOKUP
blockDescriptions.crossJoin: Create Cartesian product of two datasets (all combinations)
blockDescriptions.filterExpression: Filter rows using a Python expression for advanced conditions
blockDescriptions.numberFormat: Format numbers with thousands separators, decimals, currency, or percentage
blockDescriptions.extractPattern: Extract text matching a regex pattern into a new column
blockDescriptions.logTransform: Apply log, log10, log2, log1p, exp, or sqrt transformations with zero handling
blockDescriptions.interpolateMissing: Fill gaps using linear, polynomial, spline, nearest, or time-based interpolation
blockDescriptions.dateTruncate: Round dates to day/week/month/quarter/year/hour/minute start for grouping
blockDescriptions.periodOverPeriod: Calculate YoY, MoM, WoW, QoQ, DoD changes with absolute or percent values
blockDescriptions.hashColumn: Hash column values using SHA-256, SHA-512, MD5, SHA-1, or BLAKE2 for anonymization
blockDescriptions.expandDateRange: Fill missing dates in time series with configurable frequency and fill methods
blockDescriptions.stringSimilarity: Calculate string similarity using Levenshtein, Jaro, Jaro-Winkler for fuzzy matching
blockDescriptions.generateSequence: Create helper tables with number ranges, date ranges, or repeated patterns
blockDescriptions.topNPerGroup: Get top or bottom N rows per group based on a ranking column
blockDescriptions.firstLastPerGroup: Get the first, last, or both rows per group based on sort order
blockDescriptions.oneHotEncode: Convert categorical columns to binary indicator columns (dummy variables) for ML models like logistic regression, neural networks, and SVM
blockDescriptions.labelEncode: Convert categorical values to integer codes (0, 1, 2, ...) for tree-based ML models like XGBoost and Random Forest
blockDescriptions.ordinalEncode: Encode categorical values with user-defined order (e.g., low=1, medium=2, high=3) for ordered categories
blockDescriptions.minMaxNormalize: Scale numeric columns to [0, 1] range using (x - min) / (max - min) for neural networks and distance-based algorithms
blockDescriptions.zScoreStandardize: Transform columns to mean=0 and std=1 using (x - mean) / std for PCA, clustering, and regularized models
blockDescriptions.rollingStatistics: Calculate moving window statistics (mean, sum, min, max, std, median) for time series feature engineering
blockDescriptions.resampleTimeseries: Change time series frequency (minute to hour, day to week, etc.) with configurable aggregation and fill methods
blockDescriptions.regexReplace: Find and replace text using regular expression patterns with capture groups for complex text transformations
blockDescriptions.expandJsonColumn: Parse JSON strings in a column and expand into multiple columns for handling API responses and nested data
blockDescriptions.addUniqueId: Generate unique identifiers for each row (sequential, UUID, or hash-based) for tracking and primary keys
blockDescriptions.missingIndicator: Create binary columns indicating where values are missing (1=missing, 0=present) to preserve missingness as a feature
blockDescriptions.quantileTransform: Transform values to their quantile rank, then to uniform [0,1] or normal distribution for outlier-robust normalization
blockDescriptions.fuzzyJoin: Join datasets using approximate string matching (Levenshtein, Jaro-Winkler) to handle typos, spelling variations, and inconsistent formatting
blockDescriptions.memoryOptimizer: Automatically downcast numeric types (int64→int8, float64→float32) and convert low-cardinality strings to category to reduce memory 50-80%
blockDescriptions.cyclicalTimeEncoder: Encode time components (hour, day, month, weekday) as sin/cos pairs to preserve cyclical relationships for ML models
blockDescriptions.geographicDistance: Calculate real-world distance between coordinate pairs using Haversine formula - essential for location-based features
blockDescriptions.rareCategoryCombiner: Group infrequent categorical values into 'Other' based on frequency threshold or top-N to prevent one-hot encoding explosion
blockDescriptions.smartAutoCleaner: One-click data cleaning: smart imputation, remove constant columns, auto-detect and fix types, standardize strings, remove duplicates
blockDescriptions.interactionGenerator: Create interaction features (A×B, A/B, A+B, A-B) and polynomial terms for ML feature engineering
blockDescriptions.fuzzyDeduplicator: Identify and remove fuzzy duplicate rows using string similarity matching with optional blocking for performance
blockDescriptions.arrayAggregator: Aggregate list/array columns into scalar features (mean, sum, count, min, max) for handling nested/JSON data
blockDescriptions.targetAwareBinning: Create optimal bins using decision tree that maximize information gain relative to target variable for better ML features
blockDescriptions.anova: Analysis of variance to compare group means
blockDescriptions.survivalAnalysis: Kaplan-Meier survival analysis for time-to-event data
blockDescriptions.associationRules: Find item associations using Apriori algorithm
blockDescriptions.movingAverage: Calculate simple and exponential moving averages
blockDescriptions.trainTestSplit: Split data into training and testing sets for ML
blockDescriptions.modelEvaluation: Calculate model performance metrics (accuracy, F1, RMSE)
blockDescriptions.naiveBayes: Naive Bayes classifier for text and categorical data
blockDescriptions.paretoAnalysis: Identify vital few vs trivial many using 80/20 rule
blockDescriptions.trendAnalysis: Detect and quantify trends in time series data
blockDescriptions.forecasting: Predict future values using time series methods
blockDescriptions.textPreprocessing: Clean and prepare text data for analysis
blockDescriptions.tfidfVectorization: Convert text to TF-IDF numerical features
blockDescriptions.topicModeling: Discover hidden topics in text using LDA
blockDescriptions.similarityAnalysis: Calculate similarity between rows or find similar items
blockDescriptions.svm: Support Vector Machine for classification and regression
blockDescriptions.regressionDiagnostics: Residual analysis for validating regression models
blockDescriptions.vifAnalysis: Variance Inflation Factor to detect multicollinearity
blockDescriptions.customerLtv: Calculate customer lifetime value using RFM-based approach
blockDescriptions.churnAnalysis: Predict customer churn with feature importance analysis
blockDescriptions.growthMetrics: Calculate MoM/QoQ/YoY growth rates and CAGR
blockDescriptions.breakevenAnalysis: Calculate financial break-even point and sensitivity analysis
blockDescriptions.confidenceIntervals: Calculate confidence intervals for means and proportions
blockDescriptions.bootstrapAnalysis: Non-parametric bootstrap resampling for confidence intervals and bias estimation
blockDescriptions.posthocTests: Multiple comparison tests after ANOVA with adjusted p-values and effect sizes
blockDescriptions.powerAnalysis: Sample size and statistical power calculations for common tests
blockDescriptions.bayesianInference: Bayesian estimation for proportions, means, and A/B tests
blockDescriptions.dataQualityScore: Comprehensive data quality assessment with dimension scores and issue detection
blockDescriptions.changepointDetection: Detect structural breaks in time series using CUSUM, PELT, or binary segmentation
blockDescriptions.isolationForest: Tree-based anomaly detection for high-dimensional data using isolation principles
blockDescriptions.arimaForecasting: AutoRegressive Integrated Moving Average forecasting with seasonal components
blockDescriptions.seasonalDecomposition: Decompose time series into trend, seasonal, and residual components
blockDescriptions.monteCarloSimulation: Probabilistic modeling through random sampling for risk and uncertainty analysis
blockDescriptions.propensityScoreMatching: Match treatment and control groups based on covariate similarity
blockDescriptions.differenceInDifferences: Causal inference comparing treatment effect across time periods
blockDescriptions.factorAnalysis: Identify latent variables explaining correlations among observed variables
blockDescriptions.dbscanClustering: Density-based clustering that finds arbitrary-shaped clusters and outliers
blockDescriptions.elasticNet: Regularized regression combining L1 and L2 penalties for feature selection
blockDescriptions.varAnalysis: Vector AutoRegression for multivariate time series modeling and forecasting
blockDescriptions.interruptedTimeSeries: Analyze intervention effects on time series with segmented regression
blockDescriptions.grangerCausality: Test whether one time series helps predict another
blockDescriptions.localOutlierFactor: Density-based outlier detection measuring local deviation from neighbors
blockDescriptions.featureSelection: Select most predictive features using RFE, SelectKBest, or Mutual Information
blockDescriptions.outlierTreatment: Cap, remove, or impute outliers using IQR, Z-score, or percentile methods
blockDescriptions.dataDrift: Detect distribution shifts between reference and current data using KS-test and PSI
blockDescriptions.polynomialFeatures: Create polynomial and interaction features from numeric columns
blockDescriptions.multiOutput: Predict multiple target variables simultaneously with ensemble models
blockDescriptions.probabilityCalibration: Calibrate classifier probabilities using Platt scaling or isotonic regression
blockDescriptions.tsneReduction: Reduce high-dimensional data to 2D/3D using t-SNE for visualization
blockDescriptions.statisticalTests: Perform statistical tests: Mann-Whitney, Wilcoxon, Kruskal-Wallis, Levene
blockDescriptions.optimalBinning: Create optimal bins using decision tree or quantile methods with WoE/IV
blockDescriptions.correlationFinder: Find highly correlated pairs and identify multicollinearity issues
blockDescriptions.abTestCalculator: Calculate statistical significance for A/B tests with confidence intervals
blockDescriptions.targetEncoding: Encode categorical variables using target mean with smoothing
blockDescriptions.learningCurves: Analyze model performance vs training set size to diagnose bias/variance
blockDescriptions.imbalancedDataHandler: Handle class imbalance using SMOTE, ADASYN, undersampling, or hybrid methods
blockDescriptions.hyperparameterTuning: Optimize model parameters using Grid Search or Random Search with cross-validation
blockDescriptions.ensembleStacking: Combine multiple ML models using stacking, voting, or blending for improved predictions
blockDescriptions.advancedImputation: Sophisticated missing value imputation using KNN, Iterative (MICE), or MissForest methods
blockDescriptions.umapReduction: Dimensionality reduction using UMAP - faster than t-SNE with better global structure preservation
blockDescriptions.clusterValidation: Validate clustering quality with Silhouette, Davies-Bouldin, and Calinski-Harabasz scores
blockDescriptions.modelComparison: Compare multiple ML models side-by-side with cross-validation and statistical metrics
blockDescriptions.timeSeriesCv: Proper temporal cross-validation that respects time order to prevent data leakage
blockDescriptions.upliftModeling: Estimate individual treatment effects to identify who responds best to an intervention
blockDescriptions.quantileRegression: Predict specific quantiles to create prediction intervals with calibrated coverage
blockDescriptions.adversarialValidation: Detect distribution shift between train and test sets by training a classifier to distinguish them
blockDescriptions.customPythonCode: Execute arbitrary Python code with full pandas, numpy, and scikit-learn access for custom transformations
blockDescriptions.sqlQuery: Run SQL queries directly on dataframes using DuckDB - supports SELECT, JOIN, GROUP BY, window functions, and CTEs
blockDescriptions.autoEda: Generate comprehensive automated EDA: data types, distributions, correlations, outliers, missing values, and quality alerts
blockDescriptions.dataValidation: Define data quality rules and expectations - check nulls, ranges, patterns, uniqueness, and referential integrity
blockDescriptions.neuralNetwork: Build and train neural networks for tabular data with configurable layers, activations, dropout, and early stopping
blockDescriptions.autoFeatureEngineering: Automatically generate features: interactions, polynomials, date decomposition, binning, and lag features
blockDescriptions.shapInterpretation: Explain model predictions with SHAP values - global importance, individual explanations, dependence plots
blockDescriptions.automl: Automatically train and compare multiple models with hyperparameter tuning and cross-validation
blockDescriptions.pipelineExport: Export entire pipeline as standalone Python script with imports, transformations, and requirements.txt
blockDescriptions.multivariateAnomaly: Detect anomalies considering multiple features together using Isolation Forest, One-Class SVM, or Mahalanobis distance
blockDescriptions.causalImpact: Measure causal effect of interventions using Difference-in-Differences or synthetic control methods
blockDescriptions.modelRegistry: Save trained models to IndexedDB with versioning and metadata, or load previously saved models for inference
blockDescriptions.funnelChart: Visualize sequential stages with progressive reduction
blockDescriptions.sankeyDiagram: Show flow between nodes with proportional width bands
blockDescriptions.treemap: Display hierarchical data as nested rectangles
blockDescriptions.sunburstChart: Radial hierarchical visualization with concentric rings
blockDescriptions.radarChart: Multi-axis radial chart for comparing variables
blockDescriptions.waterfallChart: Show cumulative effect of sequential values
blockDescriptions.candlestickChart: Financial OHLC visualization for price data
blockDescriptions.choroplethMap: Geographic heatmap coloring regions by values
blockDescriptions.wordCloud: Text visualization where word size represents frequency
blockDescriptions.paretoChart: Combined bar and cumulative line for 80/20 analysis
blockDescriptions.boxPlot: Statistical distribution showing median, quartiles, and outliers
blockDescriptions.heatmap: Matrix visualization with color intensity representing values
blockDescriptions.scatterMap: Geographic points plotted on a map using latitude/longitude
blockDescriptions.groupedHistogram: Compare distributions across categories with overlapping histograms
blockDescriptions.networkGraph: Force-directed graph showing relationships between nodes
blockDescriptions.calendarHeatmap: Daily values displayed in a calendar grid format
blockDescriptions.facetedChart: Same chart repeated across different categories for comparison
blockDescriptions.densityPlot: Smooth probability density curve using kernel density estimation
blockDescriptions.errorBarChart: Bar or line chart with confidence intervals or error bars
blockDescriptions.dotPlot: Cleveland dot plot for clean categorical value comparison
blockDescriptions.slopeChart: Before/after comparison showing changes between two points
blockDescriptions.groupedBarChart: Side-by-side bars comparing subcategories within groups
blockDescriptions.bumpChart: Ranking changes over time with connected lines
blockDescriptions.donutChart: Pie chart with hollow center for proportions and center KPI display
blockDescriptions.horizontalBarChart: Horizontal bars for categorical comparisons with long labels
blockDescriptions.scatter3d: Interactive 3D scatter visualization with rotation and zoom
blockDescriptions.contourPlot: 2D density visualization showing concentration areas with contour lines
blockDescriptions.hexbinPlot: Hexagonal binning for large scatter datasets to prevent overplotting
blockDescriptions.ridgePlot: Stacked density curves comparing distributions across categories
blockDescriptions.stripPlot: Individual data points with jitter along categorical axis
blockDescriptions.bulletChart: Compact KPI visualization showing actual vs target with qualitative ranges
blockDescriptions.pyramidChart: Back-to-back horizontal bars for two-sided population comparisons
blockDescriptions.timelineChart: Events and tasks displayed along a time axis with duration bars
blockDescriptions.surface3d: Interactive 3D surface showing Z values across X-Y grid
blockDescriptions.marginalHistogram: Scatter plot with histograms on margins showing variable distributions
blockDescriptions.dumbbellChart: Connected dots showing change between two values per category
blockDescriptions.shapSummaryPlot: Display SHAP values showing feature impact on model predictions with distribution
blockDescriptions.partialDependencePlot: Show marginal effect of features on predicted outcome
blockDescriptions.featureImportancePlot: Horizontal bar chart ranking features by importance score
blockDescriptions.icePlot: Individual Conditional Expectation - show how predictions change for individual samples
blockDescriptions.precisionRecallCurve: Plot precision vs recall at various thresholds with AUC-PR score
blockDescriptions.learningCurvePlot: Show training and validation scores vs training set size for bias/variance diagnosis
blockDescriptions.residualPlot: Scatter of residuals vs fitted values for regression diagnostics
blockDescriptions.actualVsPredictedPlot: Scatter plot comparing true values to predictions with perfect prediction line
blockDescriptions.calibrationCurve: Reliability diagram showing predicted probability vs actual frequency
blockDescriptions.liftChart: Show cumulative lift of model predictions vs random baseline for marketing/churn models
blockDescriptions.elbowPlot: Plot inertia/distortion vs number of clusters (K) for optimal cluster selection
blockDescriptions.silhouettePlot: Visualize silhouette coefficient for each sample grouped by cluster
blockDescriptions.tsneUmapPlot: 2D/3D scatter plot of high-dimensional data reduced via t-SNE or UMAP
blockDescriptions.missingValueHeatmap: Matrix visualization showing missing data patterns across rows and columns
blockDescriptions.outlierDetectionPlot: Scatter/box plots highlighting statistical outliers using IQR or Z-score
blockDescriptions.distributionComparisonPlot: Overlaid density plots comparing distributions between groups or datasets
blockDescriptions.ecdfPlot: Empirical Cumulative Distribution Function - step function showing cumulative probability
blockDescriptions.andrewsCurves: Plot each observation as a Fourier series curve colored by class for multivariate visualization
blockDescriptions.cvResultsPlot: Box/violin plots showing score distribution across cross-validation folds
blockDescriptions.hyperparameterHeatmap: 2D heatmap showing performance across hyperparameter grid combinations
blockDescriptions.comprehensiveEda: Generate a complete automated EDA report with statistics, distributions, correlations, missing value analysis, and outlier detection in one click
blockDescriptions.shapDeepExplainer: Calculate SHAP values for any model to understand feature contributions, importance rankings, and interaction effects for model interpretability
blockDescriptions.stlDecomposition: Decompose time series into trend, seasonal, and residual components using STL with configurable seasonality for pattern analysis
blockDescriptions.multiAlgorithmAnomaly: Detect anomalies using ensemble of Isolation Forest, Local Outlier Factor, and Z-score methods with voting for robust detection
blockDescriptions.automatedFeaturePipeline: Automatically generate new features including polynomials, interactions, date features, binning, and text stats based on column types
blockDescriptions.distributionDriftMonitor: Compare data distributions between baseline and current datasets using KS test, PSI, and Jensen-Shannon divergence to detect data drift
blockDescriptions.smartResampling: Handle imbalanced datasets with SMOTE, ADASYN, random oversampling, or undersampling techniques with configurable parameters
blockDescriptions.collinearityDiagnostics: Analyze multicollinearity using VIF, condition number, and correlation matrix with automatic recommendations for feature removal
blockDescriptions.bayesianAbCalculator: Run Bayesian A/B tests with Beta-Binomial models to calculate probability of improvement, expected lift, and credible intervals
blockDescriptions.nestedCrossValidation: Perform unbiased model evaluation with nested CV - outer loop for evaluation, inner loop for hyperparameter tuning

hero.description: Build powerful data pipelines visually. Drag, drop, and connect blocks to transform, analyze, and visualize your data — all without writing code.
hero.trustText: Free to use. Your data never leaves your browser.

features.sectionDescription: A complete toolkit for data transformation and analysis, running entirely in your browser.

privacyFirst.title: Privacy First
privacyFirst.description: All processing happens locally in your browser. Your data never touches any server.

quickStart.title: Quick Start
quickStart.description: No installation needed. Create a free account and start building data pipelines immediately.

collaborate.title: Collaborate Live
collaborate.description: Work together with your team in real-time. Your IP address stays hidden from other users.

pythonPowered.title: Python Powered
pythonPowered.description: Full data science stack running in WebAssembly. pandas, NumPy, and scikit-learn included.

step1.title: Drop your data
step1.description: Upload CSV files or use our sample datasets to explore.

step2.title: Build your pipeline
step2.description: Drag blocks onto the canvas and connect them to create your data flow.

step3.title: See results instantly
step3.description: Run your pipeline and visualize results with charts and tables.

cta.title: Ready to transform your data?
cta.description: Join thousands of data enthusiasts building pipelines without code. Free forever, your data stays local.

auth.signUpSubtitle: Get started with Data Flow Canvas
auth.signInSubtitle: Enter your email to receive a sign-in link
auth.magicLinkSubtitle: Enter your email to receive a sign-in link
auth.magicLinkSentSubtitle: We've sent you a magic link to sign in
auth.magicLinkInstructions: Click the link in your email to sign in. The link will expire in 1 hour.
auth.completeProfileSubtitle: Tell us a bit about yourself
auth.privacyNote: Your data stays local. We only collect your profile information to personalize your experience.

errors.emailInvalid: Please enter a valid email address
errors.magicLinkFailed: Failed to send magic link. Please try again.
errors.profileUpdateFailed: Failed to update profile. Please try again.

bottomPanel.noLogs: No logs yet. Run the pipeline to see execution logs.

rightPanel.runToPreview: Run the pipeline to see data preview
rightPanel.noVisualization: Select a visualization block to see results
rightPanel.runVisualization: Run the pipeline to see visualization

projects.storedLocally: All your projects are stored locally in your browser.
projects.createFirstProject: Create your first data pipeline project to get started.

irisClassification.name: Iris Classification
irisClassification.description: Explore the classic Iris dataset with clustering and visualization.

dataCleaningPipeline.name: Data Cleaning Pipeline
dataCleaningPipeline.description: Handle missing values, filter rows, and transform columns.

linearRegression.name: Linear Regression
linearRegression.description: Build a simple regression model with visualization.

jumpToBlock.title: Jump to Block
jumpToBlock.searchPlaceholder: Search blocks by name or type...
jumpToBlock.hint: Use arrow keys to navigate, Enter to select

collaboration.title: Collaborate
collaboration.subtitle: Work together in real-time
collaboration.info1: Start a session to get a shareable room ID
collaboration.info2: Share the ID with up to 2 other people
collaboration.info3: Your IP address is hidden from other users
collaboration.privacyNote: Connections are secure and routed through Supabase. Your IP is never exposed.

errors.startFailed: Failed to start session. Please try again.
errors.joinFailed: Failed to join session. Please try again.
errors.globalFull: Collaboration is currently at capacity. Please try again later.

hero.title: Getting Started
hero.description: Learn how to use Data Flow Canvas to build visual data pipelines.

quickStart.title: Quick Start Guide
quickStart.subtitle: Get up and running in 5 simple steps

step1.title: Add Data Input
step1.description: Drag a Load Data, Sample Data, or Create Dataset block from the sidebar onto the canvas.

step2.title: Configure Your Block
step2.description: Click on the block to select it. The right panel will show configuration options. Upload a file, select a sample dataset, or enter data manually.

step3.title: Add Transform Blocks
step3.description: Drag transform blocks (Filter, Sort, etc.) and connect them by dragging from the output handle (right) of one block to the input handle (left) of another.

step4.title: Run Your Pipeline
step4.description: Click the Run button in the top bar or press Ctrl+Enter. The first run will take ~30 seconds to load Python.

step5.title: View Results
step5.description: Select a block and check the Preview or Viz tab in the right panel to see the output data.

shortcuts.title: Keyboard Shortcuts
shortcuts.subtitle: Speed up your workflow with these shortcuts

blockReference.title: Block Reference
blockReference.subtitle: Explore all available blocks by category

tips.title: Tips
tips.subtitle: Pro tips to get the most out of Data Flow Canvas

selectingBlocks.title: Selecting Blocks
selectingBlocks.description: Click on a block to select it and view its configuration. Hold Shift to select multiple blocks.

connectingBlocks.title: Connecting Blocks
connectingBlocks.description: Drag from the output handle (right side) of a block to the input handle (left side) of another to connect them.

firstRun.title: First Run
firstRun.description: The first time you run a pipeline, it takes about 30 seconds to load Python (Pyodide). Subsequent runs are much faster.

supportedFiles.title: Supported Files
supportedFiles.description: Upload CSV files to get started. You can also use the built-in sample datasets to explore.
